Thermodynamics.name: Ideal Gas Law
Thermodynamics.description: Relates pressure, volume, and temperature for an ideal gas.

Thermodynamics.name: First Law of Thermodynamics
Thermodynamics.description: Energy conservation principle applied to thermodynamic systems.

Thermodynamics.name: Enthalpy
Thermodynamics.description: Definition of enthalpy as a state function.

Thermodynamics.name: Change in Enthalpy
Thermodynamics.description: At constant pressure, enthalpy change accounts for internal energy and work.

Thermodynamics.name: Heat Capacity at Constant Volume
Thermodynamics.description: Heat required to raise the temperature of a system at constant volume.

Thermodynamics.name: Heat Capacity at Constant Pressure
Thermodynamics.description: Heat required to raise the temperature of a system at constant pressure.

Thermodynamics.name: Relation of Heat Capacities
Thermodynamics.description: Relation between heat capacities for ideal gases.

Thermodynamics.name: Isothermal Work (Ideal Gas)
Thermodynamics.description: Work done by an ideal gas in an isothermal process.

Thermodynamics.name: Polytropic Work
Thermodynamics.description: Work done in a polytropic process (n ≠ 1).

Thermodynamics.name: Entropy Change (Ideal Gas)
Thermodynamics.description: Entropy change for an ideal gas process.

Thermodynamics.name: Gibbs Free Energy
Thermodynamics.description: Determines spontaneity of processes at constant pressure and temperature.

Thermodynamics.name: Helmholtz Free Energy
Thermodynamics.description: Useful thermodynamic potential at constant volume and temperature.

Thermodynamics.name: Clausius-Clapeyron Equation
Thermodynamics.description: Relates vapor pressure change with temperature during phase change.

Thermodynamics.name: Carnot Efficiency
Thermodynamics.description: Maximum possible efficiency of a heat engine operating between two temperatures.

Thermodynamics.name: Constant Pressure Work
Thermodynamics.description: Work done during expansion or compression at constant pressure.

Thermodynamics.name: Heat Transfer (Sensible Heat)
Thermodynamics.description: Heat required to change the temperature of a substance.

Thermodynamics.name: Latent Heat
Thermodynamics.description: Heat required for a phase change at constant temperature.

Thermodynamics.name: Backward Finite Difference Method
Thermodynamics.description: A technique for the approximation of differentials.

Thermodynamics.name: Forward Finite Difference Method
Thermodynamics.description: A technique for the approximation of differentials.

Thermodynamics.name: Central Finite Difference Method
Thermodynamics.description: A technique for the approximation of differentials. The most accurate method.

Thermodynamics.name: The Cyclic Relation / Rule
Thermodynamics.formula: z = f(x,y), \quad \left( \frac{\partial x}{\partial y} \right)_{z}\left( \frac{\partial z}{\partial x} \right)_{y}\left( \frac{\partial y}{\partial z} \right)_{x}= -1

variables.z: Dependent variable defined as a function of x and y

Thermodynamics.description: The cyclic rule in thermodynamics relates three interdependent variables (such as pressure, volume, and temperature). It states that the product of three specific partial derivatives equals -1, ensuring consistency among thermodynamic relationships.

Thermodynamics.name: Reciprocity Rule

variables.x: Independent variable (e.g., pressure, volume, temperature, etc.)

Thermodynamics.description: The reciprocity rule states that the partial derivative of x with respect to y (at constant z) is the reciprocal of the partial derivative of y with respect to x (at constant z). This ensures consistency in the definition of interdependent thermodynamic variables.

Thermodynamics.name: Maxwell Relation 1
Thermodynamics.description: Relates changes in temperature with volume at constant entropy to changes in pressure with entropy at constant volume.

Thermodynamics.name: Maxwell Relation 2
Thermodynamics.description: Relates changes in temperature with pressure at constant entropy to changes in volume with entropy at constant pressure.

Thermodynamics.name: Maxwell Relation 3
Thermodynamics.description: Relates changes in entropy with volume at constant temperature to changes in pressure with temperature at constant volume.

Thermodynamics.name: Maxwell Relation 4
Thermodynamics.description: Relates changes in entropy with pressure at constant temperature to changes in volume with temperature at constant pressure.

Thermodynamics.name: Clapeyron Equation

variables.dP/dT: Slope of the phase boundary in the P-T diagram
variables.Δv: Change in specific volume between phases (m³/mol)

Thermodynamics.description: Relates the slope of a phase boundary on a pressure-temperature diagram to the latent heat and change in specific volume during a phase transition.

Thermodynamics.name: Clapeyron Equation (Liquid–Vapor Phase Change)

variables.dP/dT: Slope of saturation curve on P-T diagram

Thermodynamics.description: The Clapeyron equation for liquid–vapor phase change, relating the slope of the saturation curve to enthalpy of vaporization and volume change.

Thermodynamics.name: General Clapeyron Equation (Any Phase Change)

variables.dP/dT: Slope of the phase boundary line in a P-T diagram

Thermodynamics.description: The general Clapeyron equation, applicable to any phase change, relating the slope of the coexistence line to enthalpy and volume differences.

Thermodynamics.name: Antoine Equation

variables.P: Vapor pressure (usually in mmHg or bar)
variables.A: Antoine constant specific to the substance
variables.B: Antoine constant specific to the substance
variables.C: Antoine constant specific to the substance

Thermodynamics.description: An empirical equation used to estimate the vapor pressure of pure substances as a function of temperature.

Thermodynamics.name: Modified Clapeyron Equation (Clausius–Clapeyron Equation)
Thermodynamics.description: A simplified form of the Clapeyron equation assuming the enthalpy of vaporization is constant; relates vapor pressure and temperature during phase change.

Thermodynamics.name: Enthalpy Change Equation
Thermodynamics.formula: h_2 - h_1 = \int_{T_1}^{T_2} C_p dT + \int_{P_1}^{P_2} \left[ v - T \left( \frac{\partial v}{\partial T} \right)_P \right] dP

variables.Cp: Specific heat capacity at constant pressure

Thermodynamics.description: Equation representing the change in enthalpy between two states, accounting for temperature-dependent specific heat and pressure effects.

Thermodynamics.name: Change in Internal Energy
Thermodynamics.formula: U_2 - U_1 = \int_{T_1}^{T_2} C_v dT + \int_{V_1}^{V_2} \left[T \left( \frac{\partial P}{\partial T} \right)_V - P \right] dV

variables.Cv: Specific heat capacity at constant volume

Thermodynamics.description: Equation representing the change in internal energy between two states, considering temperature-dependent specific heat and volume effects.

Thermodynamics.name: Change in Entropy
Thermodynamics.formula: S_2 - S_1 = \int_{T_1}^{T_2} \frac{C_p}{T} dT - \int_{P_1}^{P_2} \left[\left( \frac{\partial V}{\partial T} \right)_P \right] dP

variables.Cp: Specific heat capacity at constant pressure

Thermodynamics.description: Equation representing the change in entropy between two states, accounting for temperature-dependent specific heat and pressure effects.

Thermodynamics.name: Change in Entropy
Thermodynamics.formula: S_2 - S_1 = \int_{T_1}^{T_2} \frac{C_v}{T} dT + \int_{V_1}^{V_2} \left[\left( \frac{\partial P}{\partial T} \right)_V \right] dV

variables.Cv: Specific heat capacity at constant volume

Thermodynamics.description: Equation representing the change in entropy between two states, accounting for temperature-dependent specific heat and pressure effects.

Thermodynamics.name: Change in Enthalpy (DFh)
Thermodynamics.formula: DF_h = h - h^{IG} = \int_0^P \left[ v - T \left( \frac{\partial v}{\partial T} \right)_P \right] dP
Thermodynamics.description: Equation representing the change in enthalpy relative to an ideal gas, integrating over pressure with temperature-dependent specific volume.

Thermodynamics.name: Change in Internal Energy (DFu)
Thermodynamics.formula: DF_u = u - u^{IG} = \int_\infty^v \left[ T \left( \frac{\partial P}{\partial T} \right)_v - P \right] dv
Thermodynamics.description: Equation representing the change in internal energy relative to an ideal gas, integrating over volume with temperature-dependent pressure.

Thermodynamics.name: Change in Entropy (DFs)
Thermodynamics.formula: DF_s = s - s^{IG} = -\int_0^P \left( \left( \frac{\partial v}{\partial T} \right)P - \frac{R}{P} \right) dP = \int_\infty^v \left[ \left( \frac{\partial P}{\partial T} \right)_v - \frac{R}{v} \right] dv
Thermodynamics.description: Equation representing the change in entropy relative to an ideal gas, with dual integral forms over pressure and volume.

Thermodynamics.name: Enthalpy Departure Function - van der Waals
Thermodynamics.description: Expression for the enthalpy departure function normalized by RT for the van der Waals equation of state.

Thermodynamics.name: Enthalpy Departure Function - Redlich-Kwong
Thermodynamics.description: Expression for the enthalpy departure function normalized by RT for the Redlich-Kwong equation of state.

Thermodynamics.name: Enthalpy Departure Function - Soave-Redlich-Kwong
Thermodynamics.description: Expression for the enthalpy departure function normalized by RT for the Soave-Redlich-Kwong equation of state.

Thermodynamics.name: Enthalpy Departure Function - Peng-Robinson
Thermodynamics.description: Expression for the enthalpy departure function normalized by RT for the Peng-Robinson equation of state.

Thermodynamics.name: Entropy Departure Function - van der Waals
Thermodynamics.description: Expression for the entropy departure function normalized by R for the van der Waals equation of state.

Thermodynamics.name: Entropy Departure Function - Redlich-Kwong
Thermodynamics.description: Expression for the entropy departure function normalized by R for the Redlich-Kwong equation of state.

Thermodynamics.name: Entropy Departure Function - Soave-Redlich-Kwong
Thermodynamics.description: Expression for the entropy departure function normalized by R for the Soave-Redlich-Kwong equation of state.

Thermodynamics.name: Entropy Departure Function - Peng-Robinson
Thermodynamics.description: Expression for the entropy departure function normalized by R for the Peng-Robinson equation of state.

Thermodynamics.name: Change in Internal Energy
Thermodynamics.description: Equation for the change in internal energy, derived from enthalpy change and pressure-volume work, adjusted with compressibility factors.

Thermodynamics.name: Change in Enthalpy
Thermodynamics.description: Equation for the change in reduced enthalpy, accounting for the ideal gas enthalpy difference and the generalized enthalpy departure chart.

Thermodynamics.name: Change in Entropy
Thermodynamics.description: Equation for the change in reduced entropy, accounting for the ideal gas entropy difference and the generalized entropy departure chart.

Thermodynamics.name: Coefficient of Thermal Expansion
Thermodynamics.description: The coefficient of thermal expansion, defined as the change in volume with temperature under constant pressure per unit volume.

Thermodynamics.name: Isothermal Compressibility
Thermodynamics.description: The isothermal compressibility, defined as the change in volume with pressure under constant temperature per unit volume.

Thermodynamics.name: Change in Pressure for liquids
Thermodynamics.description: Calculation of the increase in pressure of liquids contained in a constant volume as a result of temperature rise.

Thermodynamics.name: Joule-Thompson Coefficient

variables.μJT = 0: temperature remains constant with reducing pressure

Thermodynamics.description: The temperature behaviour of a fluid during a throttling process. NB: This is better if the expansitivity is not constant.
